H0.text: Maintain blood pressure is the function of the cardiovascular system working together with the respiratory system during exercise.

H1.text: Remove carbon dioxide is the action that the cardiovascular system works together with the respiratory system to perform during exercise.

H2.text: The production of red blood cells is what the cardiovascular system works together with the respiratory system during exercise.

H3.text: Filter out waste products is the action performed by the cardiovascular system working together with the respiratory system during exercise.

A4.text: The ability of the lung to oxygenate the blood must also be considered.

A5.text: oxygen carrying capacity is often the target of exercise (ergogenic aids) aids used in endurance sports to increase the volume percentage of red blood cells (hematocrit), such as through blood doping or the use of erythropoietin (EPO).
